A derivative in calculus represents the rate of change of a function.

For a function f(x), the derivative f'(x) at x=a is the limit of [f(a+h) - f(a)]/h as h approaches 0.

It’s used to find slopes of tangents and optimize functions.

William Shakespeare (1564–1616) was an English playwright.

His works include 38 plays like Hamlet and 154 sonnets.

His themes explore love and power, influencing literature.

Photosynthesis is how plants convert light into energy.

The equation is 6CO₂ + 6H₂O + light → C₆H₁₂O₆ + 6O₂, occurring in chloroplasts with chlorophyll.

Leaves use this for growth, producing oxygen.

The French Revolution (1789–1799) was a major upheaval.

Key events include the fall of the Bastille and the Reign of Terror.

It was driven by inequality and Enlightenment ideas.
